sponsor: Novadaq Technologies ULC, now a part of Stryker
briefTitle: A Study Assessing the Safety and Effectiveness of IC2000 and SPY Fluorescence Imaging Systems (SPY-PHI) in the Visualization of Lymphatic Vessels and Identification of Lymph Nodes During Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy in Subjects With Breast Cancer
officialTitle: Single Arm, Prospective, Open Label, Multicenter Study Assessing the Safety and Effectiveness of IC2000 and SPY Fluorescence Imaging Systems in the Visualization of Lymphatic Vessels and Lymph Nodes During Lymphatic Mapping and Sentinel Lymph Node Biopsy in Subjects With Breast Cancer

interventions.name: Tc-99m radioactive colloid and Gamma Probe

summary: This is a prospective, open label, multicenter, non-inferiority within-patient study to determine the effectiveness of IC2000 (Indocyanine Green (ICG) for Injection) and the SPY Portable Handheld Imaging System (SPY-PHI) as an intraoperative fluorescence visualization tool, in the visual identification of lymphatic vessels and lymph nodes (LNs) during lymphatic mapping and sentinel lymph node biopsy (SLNB) procedures as confirmed by Technitium99m (Tc99m) and Gamma Probe.

primaryOutcome.measure: Proportion of Lymph Nodes Identified by IC2000/SPY-PHI Compared to the Proportion of Lymph Nodes Identified by Tc99m/Gamma Probe
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: From Technetium-99 (Tc-99m) injection to the completion of surgery
